data.Sentence_cn: 不必担心
data.Sentence: --- lesson 39  Nothing to worry about

data.Sentence_cn: 穿越平原的道路高低不平，开车走了不远，路面愈加崎岖。我们想劝说布鲁斯把车开回我们出发的那个村庄去。
data.Sentence: The rough road across the plain soon became so bad that we tried to get Bruce to drive back to the village we had come from.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管路面布满石头，坑坑洼洼，但布鲁斯却一点儿不慌乱。
data.Sentence: Even though the road was littered with boulders and pitted with holes, Bruce was not in the least perturbed.

data.Sentence_cn: 他瞥了一眼地图，告诉我们前面再走不到20英里就是一个村庄。
data.Sentence: Glancing at his map, he informed us that the next village was a mere twenty miles away.

data.Sentence_cn: 这并不是说布鲁斯总是低估困难，
data.Sentence: It was not that Bruce always underestimated difficulties.

data.Sentence_cn: 而是他压根儿没有一点儿危险感。
data.Sentence: He simply had no sense of danger at all.

data.Sentence_cn: 他认为不管路面情况如何，车必须以最高速度前进。
data.Sentence: No matter what the conditions were, he believed that a car should be driven as fast as it could possibly go.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们在尘士飞扬的道路上颠簸，车子东拐西弯，以躲开那些大圆石。
data.Sentence: As we bumped over the dusty track, we swerved to avoid large boulders.

data.Sentence_cn: 车轮搅起的石块锤击车身，发出不祥的锤击声。
data.Sentence: The wheels scooped up stones which hammered ominously under the car.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们相信迟早会飞起一个石块把油箱砸开一个窟窿，或者把发动机砸坏。
data.Sentence: We felt sure that sooner or later a stone would rip a hole in our petrol tank or damage the engine.

data.Sentence_cn: 因此，我们不时地掉过头，怀疑车后是否留下了机油和汽油的痕迹。
data.Sentence: Because of this, we kept looking back, wondering if we were leaving a trail of oil and petrol behind us.

data.Sentence_cn: 突然大石块不见了，前面是一片平地，唯一的障碍只有一簇簇灌木丛。这使我们长长地松了口气。
data.Sentence: What a relief it was when the boulders suddenly disappeared,giving way to a stretch of plain where the only obstacles were clumps of bushes.

data.Sentence_cn: 但是更糟糕的事情在等着我们，
data.Sentence: But there was worse to come.

data.Sentence_cn: 离我们不远处，出现了一个大裂缝。
data.Sentence: Just ahead of us there was a huge fissure.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们再次央求布鲁斯小心，他这才把车停了下来。
data.Sentence: In response to renewed pleadings, Bruce stopped.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们纷纷下车察看那个大裂缝，他却呆在车上。
data.Sentence: Though we all got out to examine the fissure, he remained in the car.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们告诉他那个大裂缝长50码，宽2英尺，深4英尺。
data.Sentence: We informed him that the fissure extended for fifty yards and was tow feet wide and four feet deep.

data.Sentence_cn: 这也没有对他产生任何影响。
data.Sentence: Even this had no effect.

data.Sentence_cn: 布鲁斯挂上慢档，把两只前轮分别搁在裂缝的两边，顺着弯弯曲曲的裂缝，以发疯的速度向前开去。
data.Sentence: Bruce went into a low gear and drove at a terrifying speed, keeping the front wheels astride the crack as he followed its zigzag course.

data.Sentence_cn: 我们还未来得及担心后果，车已重新开上了平地。
data.Sentence: Before we had time to worry about what might happen, we were back on the plain again.

data.Sentence_cn: 布鲁斯又看了一眼地图，告诉我们那座村庄离我们只有15英里了。
data.Sentence: Bruce consulted the map once more and told us that the village was now only fifteen miles away.

data.Sentence_cn: 下一个障碍是一片约半英里宽的浅水塘。
data.Sentence: Our next obstacle was a shallow pool of water about half a mile across.

data.Sentence_cn: 布鲁斯向水塘冲去，但车开到水塘当中，嘎吱一声停住了。
data.Sentence: Bruce charged at it, but in the middle, the car came to a grinding halt.

data.Sentence_cn: 仪表盘一盏黄灯闪着刺眼的光芒，布鲁斯兴致勃勃地宣布发动机里没油了！
data.Sentence: A yellow light on the dashboard flashed angrily and Bruce cheerfully announced that there was no oil in the engine!
